Pavillon Noir ! *Règles d'escarmouche pour Flibustiers* is a pirate skirmish miniature wargame.

The game uses a simple activation system between players. This extension adds 3 chapters, boarding parties, on the bridge and a few more weapons, as well as a scenario *Que le Grand Cric me Croque !*

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn sequence = a few seconds

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

Name: Western Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion
Description:
Western Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion is an expansion set that is compatible with Mega Empires: The West (2019) and Mega Civilization (2015). It provides additional flavor to the game through 9 miniatures of ancient buildings historically associated with each of the civilizations in the game. These buildings can be build on the map board and provide additional benefits in play and victory points to their controller.

—description from the designers

Name: Heroes of Normandie: The Tactical Card Game – D-DAY
Description:
On D-Day, the Americans will take every beach they assault with titanic naval, aerial and land strength. There will be easy landings like at Utah Beach, and murderous ones like Omaha Beach. Shocked by carpet-bombing, the Wehrmacht will nevertheless react and counter-attack. The Americans will be at risk of a catastrophic re-embarkation several times.

THIS EXPANSIONS REQUIRES THE CORE BOX.

Expansion Content :

22 US cards
    21 German cards
    6 hero tokens
    1 double-sided Battle Map
    1 rule sheet
    2 scenario sheets
    40 markers

Exclusive content : Rangers Lead the way

1 double-sided Battle Map
    6 US cards
    1 scenario sheet

—first edition
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Foodfighters: The Sweet Expansion
Description:
Another delicious expansion faction! The Sweets faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three Sweets-only power cards, and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Foodfighters: The Salty Expansion
Description:
Another high-sodium expansion faction! The Salty faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three Salty-only power cards, and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: DinoSporrrt 2.0
Description:
For whom:
DinoSporrrt for children and adults, for rest with family, friends, in the party. For all who like excitement, activity, laughter and dinosaurs)

What gives:
You can drive balls alone, but it is more fun for two or two against one or even four! The kids play simultaneously with two hands, the figures rotate with their fingers (they can be played separately). Unlike similar sports games, you can navigate around the field. In order to play from the age of 3, small parts were removed from DinoSporrrt, which is also convenient when traveling.

Name: Dragon Busters
Description:
The aim it to circle the castle once counterclockwise. The choice of the way is freely selectable.
At the beginning, the game machine is set up with the towers. The dragon comes into the courtyard. Each chooses a character and places it on its tower on an outer edge. 
The active player turns the rotary arrow. Afterwards each player is allowed to move his character as many spaces as indicated at movement points. If a player ends his move in an occupied space, he simply moves on to the next empty space. At intersections the direction may be freely chosen, whereby it is clearly dangerous along the inner courtyard.
If the dragon symbol is turned, the active player must activate the dragon. He pushes the lever as a trigger to a freely selectable point and lets him go. The dragon now winds its way across the field and beats against the towers until after a certain time it is switched off by the device alone. The duration of its movement depends on the position of the trigger.
If Knights have fallen down or been knocked down by towers, they must begin their journey again from the beginning. This also applies to knights who have been completely pushed off their current field! The dragon is then placed back in the middle of the castle.
End of the game: If a knight manages to completely circle the castle, the game is over.

—user summary

Name: Le casse du siècle
Description:
The goal of the game is to find the 4 digits of the secret combination of the box.
At the beginning of the game each player takes a keychain consisting of 4 keys and memorizes the numbers written on the keys.
In turn, the player places on the board, face up, all the keys he can place on one or more doors by respecting the number and the letter written on each lock. He rejects, face down, the keys he could not place and place them on incomplete trousseaux. When all the locks of a door are put, the player who places the key will have the right to look at one of the gears. The first player to discover the 4-digit combination wins.

—user summary

Name: La route enchantée
Description:
It is a game of course and road safety. The players leave box 1 and must join box 123 where the castle is located. Players drive on roads and must respect the rules of the road. During the game, players must watch their opponents and report infractions before the next player rolls the die. The first player to reach the castle with both cars won.

—user summary

Name: StoneRow
Description:
StoneRow is a medieval-themed, hand-management card game with a bit of Take That and Set Collection mechanics. The objective is to accumulate points and become the player with the most points by the time the tower is built in order to be declared the winner.

The game is tracked by the building of a 5-6 card tower. During the game, players have the opportunity to steal or break points.

—description from the designer
